attractions.name: Burj Khalifa
attractions.desc: World’s tallest tower with an observation deck.

attractions.name: Old Dubai (Al Fahidi & Creek)
attractions.desc: Historic district, abras (boats), spice & gold souks.

attractions.name: Desert Safari
attractions.desc: Dune bashing, camel rides, and Bedouin-style dinner.

cultural_tips: Dress modestly in religious or traditional areas.
Public displays of affection are discouraged.
Friday is a key prayer day; some places open later.

attractions.name: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
attractions.desc: Iconic white marble mosque open to visitors.

attractions.name: Louvre Abu Dhabi
attractions.desc: World-class art museum on Saadiyat Island.

cultural_tips: Mosques have dress codes; borrow abayas/scarves if needed.
Taxis and public transport are reliable; use official apps.

attractions.name: Al Noor Island
attractions.desc: Garden with sculptures and Butterfly House.

cultural_tips: Sharjah is the most conservative emirate; modest dress is important.
food: Local bakeries for fresh bread and tea

attractions.name: Jebel Jais
attractions.desc: UAE’s highest peak with viewing decks and zipline.

cultural_tips: Temperatures cooler in the mountains; bring layers.
food: Local fish grills near the corniche

attractions.name: Snoopy Island (Dibba)
attractions.desc: Snorkeling and beach day trips on the east coast.

cultural_tips: Great weekend escape from Dubai—plan 1.5–2.5 hours drive.

country_facts: Weekend is typically Saturday–Sunday (with Friday important for congregational prayers).
Taxis are metered; Nol/Hafilat cards for some public transit.
cultural_tips_general: During Ramadan, eating/drinking in public during daylight is restricted.
Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory (5–10%).
